OOC:  Sorry, Malice's bio is lost somewhere, I'll find it later.  But Organics' bio is in the character bio folder in the Files section.

dewboy30816 <dewboy30816@...> wrote:OOC: I couldn't find either of their bios, what faction are they 
in?  Give me some background.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, robert riley <bustercross365@y...> 
wrote:
> OOC:  Go after Malice or Organics.  They will be quite a handful.  
Worthy quarry I think.
> 
> dewboy30816 <dewboy30816@y...> wrote:Seer stared around his 
circle.  Each wore a hood making them 
> indistinguishable.  On his left sat Deus, a heartless opportunist; 
> in front of him sat Ex, a female bot who wished more than anything 
> to know what the future held; and to his right was his most 
fearsome 
> ally Machina, a warrior who wanted merely to live forever, and was 
> willing to do whatever it took to break the prophesy that doomed 
the 
> three of them.
> 
> Seer, however, was under no such restraint.  He could not die, but 
> nor could he leave his palace.  In it destiny energy flowed 
through 
> him, he knew all possible pasts and presents, and most futures, 
and 
> existed in all he could see.  Deus shuffled nervously, he was 
> planning a betrayal, and he knew Seer knew it, but he also knew 
that 
> his betrayal was too small to bother with in retrospect of what 
Seer 
> was trying to accomplish.  Deus' companion would die, but he would 
> live�for now.
> 
>       "The timelines are shifting wildly out of control," Seer 
> said, opening the meeting.
> 
>       "Yes, but is it worth the risk to intervene and try and stop 
> it," said Machina.  He had never been able to see beyond risks, 
that 
> was why he was destined to fail at his overall purpose.
> 
>       "We   will not stop it.  Because of this�Neo Beast War the 
> potential pasts and presents are multiplying along with the 
future, 
> but we must gain more destiny potential in order to control it.  
> Some presents are shifting away, becoming obscure.  Thankfully 
this 
> course of events has provided us with an ample source of 
potential.  
> All actions in a past so distant are magnified in the present.  By 
> stealing the potential of even one bot who vaguely resembles a 
hero 
> or villain we could very well achieve the equivalent of destroying 
> Optimus Prime."
> 
>       "Master, I volunteer for this service," said Ex.
> 
>       "No!" cut in Deus, "I-I mean in such a time period the 
> destiny energy could magnify the potential for the prophesy of our 
> demise being fulfilled.  We must send someone else."
> 
>       "Who else could be entrusted with such a task?" asked 
> Machina.
> 
>       "I will personally vouch for Fortuneteller," said Deus with 
> confidence.  All three of the other bots at the meeting burst into 
> laughter.
> 
>       "You would send one of our lowest level deviners?" asked Ex.
> 
>       "And your lover at that," said Machina.
> 
>       Seer laughed for a moment with them, but then considered the 
> idea.  He called on his prescience, and saw the potential for his 
> own ends.  Fortuneteller might think she was working for Deus, but 
> he knew he could make her do whatever he wanted in the end with a 
> few of Deus' screams if she refused to comply with his 
will.  "Very 
> well!  She will go, and she will remember her prophesy `So long as 
> you pay the Seer's price, no Transmetal will take your life.'  Now 
> let us select the target we can gain the most by destroying."
> 
> 
>       Deus kissed her, and ran his fingers through her hair.  "I 
> am yours," she said, "what do you wish me to do."
> 
>       "Go to Earth.  Bring me the destiny potential of the bot you 
> have been ordered to kill.  Say he died before you got to him.  
Only 
> you, I, and Seer will know."
> 
>       "But Seer is the one who wants the destiny potential."
> 
>       "Yes, but he knows everything we've done against him, and 
> hasn't acted.  Obviously we're necessary to avoid some future he 
> would prefer not to face.  We just need to keep working."
> 
>       "But I would break my prophesy, and lose my inability to be 
> killed by transmetals."
> 
>       "Isn't it worth it?  Isn't it worth it for me?"  He kissed 
> her again.
> 
>       "Yes, my love.  Yes is it."
> 
> OOC: O.k., I need a volunteer for Fortuneteller's quarry.
> 
>
